description:
8.99 lv2
Load a LV2 (LADSPA Version 2) plugin.

To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-lv2.

c.description: Set the '|' separated list of controls which are zero or more floating point values that determine the behavior of the loaded plugin (for example delay, threshold or gain). If 'controls' is set to 'help', all available controls and their valid ranges are printed.

controls.description: Set the '|' separated list of controls which are zero or more floating point values that determine the behavior of the loaded plugin (for example delay, threshold or gain). If 'controls' is set to 'help', all available controls and their valid ranges are printed.

d.description: Set the minimum duration of the sourced audio. See the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. Note that the resulting duration may be greater than the specified duration, as the generated audio is always cut at the end of a complete frame. If not specified, or the expressed duration is negative, the audio is supposed to be generated forever. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

duration.description: Set the minimum duration of the sourced audio. See the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. Note that the resulting duration may be greater than the specified duration, as the generated audio is always cut at the end of a complete frame. If not specified, or the expressed duration is negative, the audio is supposed to be generated forever. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

n.description: Set the number of samples per channel per each output frame. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

nb_samples.description: Set the number of samples per channel per each output frame. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

p.description: Specifies the plugin URI. You may need to escape ':'

plugin.description: Specifies the plugin URI. You may need to escape ':'

s.description: Specify the sample rate. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

sample_rate.description: Specify the sample rate. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

name: lv2

parameters.description: Specifies the plugin URI. You may need to escape ’:’.
parameters.name: plugin, p

parameters.description: Set the ’|’ separated list of controls which are zero or more floating point values that determine the behavior of the loaded plugin (for example delay, threshold or gain). If controls is set to help, all available controls and their valid ranges are printed.
parameters.name: controls, c

parameters.description: Specify the sample rate, default to 44100. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.
parameters.name: sample_rate, s

parameters.description: Set the number of samples per channel per each output frame, default is 1024. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.
parameters.name: nb_samples, n

parameters.description: Set the minimum duration of the sourced audio. See (ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. Note that the resulting duration may be greater than the specified duration, as the generated audio is always cut at the end of a complete frame. If not specified, or the expressed duration is negative, the audio is supposed to be generated forever. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.
parameters.name: duration, d

source:
8.99 lv2

Load a LV2 (LADSPA Version 2) plugin.

To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with --enable-lv2.

plugin, p

Specifies the plugin URI. You may need to escape ’:’.

controls, c

Set the ’|’ separated list of controls which are zero or more floating point values that determine the behavior of the loaded plugin (for example delay, threshold or gain). If controls is set to help, all available controls and their valid ranges are printed.

sample_rate, s

Specify the sample rate, default to 44100. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

nb_samples, n

Set the number of samples per channel per each output frame, default is 1024. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.

duration, d

Set the minimum duration of the sourced audio. See (ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax. Note that the resulting duration may be greater than the specified duration, as the generated audio is always cut at the end of a complete frame. If not specified, or the expressed duration is negative, the audio is supposed to be generated forever. Only used if plugin have zero inputs.
